original_title: Court prevents protests near Colombo General Hospital for 24 hours
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); A Sri Lankan court issued an order against the All Ceylon Dengue Prevention Assistants' Association (ACDPAA) on Thursday (20) preventing them from protesting along the roads around Hospital Square in Colombo, and on the pavements.
The order was issued by the Maligakanda Magistrate's Court after considering the submissions made by the OIC of the Maradana Police Station.

Sri Lanka Police informed the court that the All Ceylon Dengue Prevention Assistants' Association (ACDPAA) and its members were preparing to state a sathyagraha campaign by setting up a makeshift tent opposite the Ministry of Health, and thus obstructing the pavement and the road.

Sri Lanka Police pointed out that there was a risk the group would trespass into the Ministry of Health, and such an event could inconvenience the movement of vehicles, the general public, as well as those visiting the General Hospital for treatment.
The OIC of the Maradana Police Station added that such a situation would also lead to a collapse in essential state services.

Upon considering the facts presented by the police, the Maligakanda Magistrate's Court issued an order preventing the All Ceylon Dengue Prevention Assistants' Association (ACDPAA) from protesting and marching along the roads around the National Hospital, and Hospital Square in Maradana from 8:30 AM on Thursday (20) to 8:30 AM on Friday (21).

The order was issued against the Chairman, Secretary, and 11 others of the All Ceylon Dengue Prevention Assistants' Association (ACDPAA), as well as those who would be accompanying them for any protest.
